authentication failure for "/ucre": Password Mismatch

I try against a Lotus Domino Server (our corporate server mail domain) and I'm 
the administrator of everything (Network, Security, Unix BOX, Apache 2.2.0 
server, DOMINO domain, .........

The password supplied IS VALID. Trought other WEB places with different loads 
WebSphere, ISAPI Filter for LDAP for IIS5, 6          works fine (the one in 
ISAPI has been setup by me in past.

With authnz_ldap strangely I get back a PASSWORD MISMATCH

  AuthType basic
  AuthBasicProvider ldap
  AuthName "UCRE"
  AuthLDAPUrl ldap://server-name.domain.xx:389/o=GSI,c=it?uid?sub NONE
  AuthLDAPBindDN <censored for security>
  AuthLDAPBindPassword <censored for secutiry>
  require valid-user

* On the LDAP Server I get NO MESSAGES of Failed DN Bind. So the authentication 
to query the LDAP pass. If I change the password "correctly" warn me about a 
FAILED DN BIND REQUEST! so it work but say MISMATCH to user's passwords.
creator: alcol@hotmail.com
bnicholes@apache.org
text:
Are you sure that you are not failing authorization?  In order to use the 
valid-user authorization, your configuration will also 
need 'AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off' and mod_authz_user module will have to be 
loaded.  Otherwise mod_authnz_ldap will attempt to authorize the user and 
since it doesn't know what 'valid-user' means, it fails the request.

creator: alcol@hotmail.com
text:
With AuthzLDAPAuthoritative off it works fine but from the MOD manual page was 
not so clear at least today for me.
